drupalNodeEvent.title: A Way of Life: Things, Thought, and Action in Chinese Medicine

field_speakers.processed: Judith Farquhar (University of Chicago), P. Sean Brotherton (University of Chicago)

field_organizers.processed: University of Chicago Center for East Asian Studies

field_description.processed: Part of the East Asia by the Book! CEAS Author Talks series, this event features University of Chicago Professor, Judith Farquhar, and her book, "A Way of Life: Things, Thought, and Action in Chinese Medicine," which offers a philosophical introduction to Chinese traditional medicine. Reflection on the things recognized by Chinese medicine presents fresh problems in ontology. A reading of scholarly writing and thought in the field proposes a challenging epistemology. And a view of Chinese medical action through a pragmatic lens suggests that there is no thing or thought outside of practical imperatives. This program also features University of Chicago's P. Sean Brotherton as Discussant.
